Welcome to hw14’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is a simple function that checks if the database connection is working. It does this by making a request to the database and checking if it returns any results. If there are no results, then we know something went wrong with our connection.

Parameters:

db – AsyncSession: Inject the database session into the function

Returns:

A dictionary with the message &quot;welcome to fastapi!&quot;

Doc-author:

Trelent

main.index(request: Request)¶
The index function is responsible for returning the index page of our website.
It does this by using a TemplateResponse object, which takes in two arguments:

  1. The name of the template to be rendered (in this case, ‘index.html’)

  2. A context dictionary containing any variables that need to be passed into the template

Parameters:

request – Request: Get the request object

Returns:

A templateresponse object

Doc-author:

Trelent

main.lifespan(app: FastAPI)¶

The lifespan function is a FastAPI lifecycle hook that runs before the app starts and after it stops.

Parameters:

app – FastAPI: Pass the fastapi instance to the function

Returns:

A function

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactSchema: Validate the body of the request

  • db:AsyncSession – Pass the database session object to the function

  • user – User: Get the user object from the request

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶
The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to delete. db (AsyncSession): An async session object for interacting with the database. user (User): The user who is deleting this contact, used to ensure that only contacts belonging to this user are deleted.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be deleted

  • db:AsyncSession – Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Ensure that the user is deleting their own contact

Returns:

The contact that was deleted

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_all_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_all_contacts function returns a list of all contacts in the database.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Skip the first n rows, and limit: int is used to limit the number of returned rows

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The get_contact function returns a contact object from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be retrieved

  • db:AsyncSession – Pass in the database session

  • user – User: Filter the query to only return contacts that belong to the user

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the user.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip

  • db:AsyncSession – Pass in the database session

  • user – User: Filter the contacts by user

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_with_birthday_in_period(count_of_days: int, limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The get_contacts_with_birthday_in_period function returns a list of contacts with birthdays in the specified period.

Parameters:

  • count_of_days – int: Specify the number of days from today to search for contacts with birthdays

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned by the query

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip before starting to return the records

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Filter the contacts by user

Returns:

A list of contacts, but the function is called in a loop

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(query: str, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶
The search_contacts function searches the database for contacts that match a given query.

The function takes in a string, which is the search query, and returns all contacts that match the search criteria.

Parameters:

  • query – str: Search for a contact by first name, last name or email

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database connection

  • user – User: Filter the results to only show contacts that belong to the user

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdateSchema, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to update. body (ContactUpdateSchema): A schema containing all fields that can be updated for a Contact object. db (AsyncSession): An async session with an open connection to the database. user (User): The user who is making this request, used for authorization purposes only.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be updated

  • body – ContactUpdateSchema: Validate the request body

  • db:AsyncSession – Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Check if the contact belongs to the user

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession)¶

The confirmed_email function marks a user as confirmed in the database.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of the user

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a UserSchema object as input and returns the newly created user.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

The user object that was created

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_user_by_email function returns a user object from the database based on the email address provided.

If no user is found, None is returned.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass in the email address of the user we want to retrieve

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session into the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar_url(email: str, url: str | None, db: AsyncSession) → User¶

The update_avatar_url function updates the avatar url of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Find the user in the database

  • url – str | None: Specify the url of the avatar

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: AsyncSession)¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Specify the user object that is being updated

  • token – str | None: Update the refresh token of a user

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

Nothing

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

The function takes in a ContactSchema object, which is validated by pydantic. If the validation fails, an error will be thrown and no contact will be created. If the validation succeeds, then we create a new contact using our repository layer.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactSchema: Validate the body of the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to delete. db (AsyncSession): The database session object. user (User): The current logged in user, as returned by auth_service’s get_current_user function.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact_id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_all_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_all_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

The limit and offset parameters are used to paginate the results.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • ge – Set a minimum value for the limit parameter

  • le – Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Set the offset for pagination

  • ge – Specify a minimum value for the parameter

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository

  • user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_contact function returns a contact by id.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to return. db (AsyncSession): A database connection object. user (User): The current logged in user, if any.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the path

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the current user.

The limit and offset parameters are used to paginate the results.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • ge – Specify the minimum value that can be passed to the limit parameter

  • le – Limit the number of contacts returned to 500

  • offset – int: Skip the first n records

  • ge – Specify the minimum value for a parameter

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts_with_birthday_in_period(count_of_days: int = Query(1), limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_contacts_with_birthday_in_period function returns a list of contacts with birthday in period.
The function takes the following parameters:

count_of_days - number of days from today to search for birthdays (default 1) limit - maximum number of contacts to return (default 10, max 500) offset - how many records to skip before returning results (default 0)

Parameters:

  • count_of_days – int: Determine the period of time in which you want to get contacts with a birthday

  • ge – Specify the minimum value that can be passed to the parameter

  • le – Set the upper limit of the number of days

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • ge – Check if the value is greater than or equal to the specified value

  • le – Set the maximum value of a parameter

  • offset – int: Skip the first n records

  • ge – Specify the minimum value of the parameter

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

Returns:

A list of contactswithbirthdayinperiod objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.search_contacts(contact_data: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The search_contacts function searches for contacts in the database.
Args:

contact_data (str): The search string to be used to find contacts. db (AsyncSession): The database session object. user (User): The current user object, which is passed from the auth_service dependency function get_current_user().

Parameters:

  • contact_data – str: Search for a contact in the database

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the user id of the current logged in user

Returns:

A list of contacts, but the function returns a list of dictionaries

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactUpdateSchema, contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

body (ContactUpdateSchema): The schema for updating a contact. contact_id (int): The id of the user to update. db (AsyncSession): A connection to the database, provided by FastAPI’s dependency injection system. user (User): The current logged-in user, provided by FastAPI’s dependency injection system and our custom auth_service module.&lt;/code&gt;

Parameters:

  • body – ContactUpdateSchema: Validate the request body

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A contact object, which is a pydantic model

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.get_current_user(user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be injected into the

get_current_user endpoint. It uses the auth_service to retrieve the current user, and returns it if found.

Parameters:

user – User: Get the user object from the database

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.update_avatar(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file from the request

  • user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

The user object, but the swagger documentation says it returns a string

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. Then, it checks if that user exists in our database, and if they do not exist, we raise an HTTPException with a status code of 400 (Bad Request) and detail message &quot;Verification error&quot;.

If they do exist in our database but their confirmed field is already True (meaning their email has already been confirmed), then we return a JSON response with message &quot;Your email is already confirmed&quot;. Otherwise, we call

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection

Returns:

The following:

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

The access_token, refresh_token and token type

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the refresh token from the request header

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A new access_token and a new refresh_token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(username: str, response: Response, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The request_email function is called when a user opens an email.

It saves the username to the database and returns a 1x2 pixel image that is used as a tracking pixel.

Parameters:

  • username – str: Get the username of the user who opened the email

  • response – Response: Get the ip address of the user

  • db – AsyncSession: Access the database

Returns:

A png image

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes an email and password as input, hashes the password, and stores it in the database. If there is already a user with that email address, it returns an error message.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A userschema object, which is a dict

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

SECRET_KEY = '974790aec4ac460bdc11645decad4dce7c139b7f2982b7428ec44e886ea588c6'¶
cache = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_access_token function creates a JWT token with the given payload.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded in the token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

A string

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a JWT token. The token is encoded with the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM defined in the class. The dictionary passed to this function should contain at least an email key, but can also include other keys that will be included in the payload of the JWT.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that we want to encode

Returns:

A token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): The data to be encoded in the JWT. This should include at least a username and an email address, but can also include other information such as roles or permissions. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The number of seconds until this token expires, defaults to 7 days if not specified.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Store the user’s id and username

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the refresh token

Returns:

An encoded refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶
The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token.

The function will return an email if the refresh token is valid, otherwise it will raise an HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email of the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the UserController class. It takes a token as an argument and returns the user object associated with that token. If no user is found, it raises an HTTPException.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • token – str: Get the token from the request headers

  • db – AsyncSession: Get a database session

Returns:

A user object that contains the following:

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function first decodes the token using jwt.decode, which is part of PyJWT, a Python library for encoding and decoding JSON Web Tokens (JWTs). If successful, it will return the email address associated with that JWT.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that we want to decode

Returns:

The email address that is stored in the token

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶
The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password.

The function uses the pwd_context object to generate a hash from the given password.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Get the password from the user

Returns:

A hash of the password

Doc-author:

Trelent

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶
The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and the hashed version of that password,

and returns True if they match, False otherwise. This is used to verify that the user’s login credentials are correct.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • plain_password – Pass in the password that is being verified

  • hashed_password – Verify the password

Returns:

A boolean value

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to verify their email address.
The function takes in three arguments:

-email: the user’s email address, which is used as a unique identifier for them. -username: the username of the user, which is displayed in the body of the message. -host: this is used to construct a URL that will be sent in an HTML template.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the user who will receive the email

  • username – str: Pass the username to the template

  • host – str: Pass the host name of your website to the email template

Returns:

True if the email was sent, false otherwise

Doc-author:

Trelent
